channel.title: How to add a command?
channel.description: Ok, how would i add a command that would change your inventory... Like... ::teleport and it would show places u can teleport in ur inv (pics or words)and u click one and u go one OR ::woodcutting and u click one it shows u logs of dif logs and u click one and u get that log (certain amount)

item.title: How to add a command?
item.dc:creator: @hellobud hellobud
item.description:
@hellobud wrote:

i dont really like that format but heres a command that i just made that basicly you type ::woodcut and you get a dragon axe and it sends you a message which you can change

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("woodcut")) { addItem(6739,1); sendMessage("hellobud tells you to make me a fire bitch!"); }

just to answer redfro’s question

Read full topic

item.title: How to add a command?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Replace the # with the sidebaricon replace the #### with the interface id

Read full topic

item.title: How to add a command?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Yeah you can make an interface in the inventory area
setSidebarInterface(#, ####);

Read full topic

item.title: How to add a command?
item.dc:creator: @maxxy maxxy
item.description:
@maxxy wrote:

i know but can you have an interface in the inventory area? like that pops up with messages?

Read full topic

item.title: How to add a command?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Showing an interface is server side
showInterface(####);

Read full topic

item.title: How to add a command?
item.dc:creator: @maxxy maxxy
item.description:
@maxxy wrote:

I’m not sure that you can make interfaces pop up in the inventory. I think that’s clientside but you can make a command like this thats gives you items:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("barrows"))
			{
        			addItem(4716, 1);
        			addItem(4718, 1);
        			addItem(4720, 1);
        			addItem(4722, 1);
        			addItem(4708, 1);
        			addItem(4710, 1);
        			addItem(4712, 1);
        			addItem(4714, 1);
        			addItem(4753, 1);
        			addItem(4755, 1);
        			addItem(4757, 1);
        			addItem(4759, 1);
        			addItem(4745, 1);
        			addItem(4747, 1);
        			addItem(4749, 1);
        			addItem(4751, 1);
        			addItem(4732, 1);
        			addItem(4734, 1);
        			addItem(4736, 1);
        			addItem(4738, 1);
        			addItem(4726, 1);
        			addItem(4728, 1);
        			addItem(4730, 1);
        			addItem(4724, 1);
			}

Read full topic

item.title: How to add a command?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Search for public void customcommand and that is where you would make/edit commands.

Read full topic
